channel.title: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?
channel.description: Like i said above, do i just need to give them the client files? Or is there more to it than that?

item.title: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?
item.dc:creator: @GabbeIzABawz GabbeIzABawz.
item.description:
@GabbeIzABawz wrote:

If i were you i’d Jar the client, there are plenty youtube guides on how to do this.

Read full topic
item.source: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?

item.title: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Yes, you need to give them the client files. You can JAR the client as above said, or you can delete the .java files after you compile. The JVM only runs the .class files. Then, hide the files inside the folder, making only the batch file for the client visible. Delete the compiler and any other tools as well. It’s difficult to make the client completely uneditable.

Read full topic
item.source: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?

item.title: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

tyb97:

^True, I have that decompiler, but when I try and hack clients, some symbols don’t decompile correctly… and those damn anti-leeches… jaring just takes the temptation away. I guess.

Obfuscation, I don’t think the actual Jar part has anything to do with it (unless you’re using case sensitive jar files, which is obfuscation).

Read full topic

item.title: What files do i need to release to people so they can play online?
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

tyb97:

Jar your client, so it does not get hacked, and make the cache auto download, and then just give them the .jar file that you made.

LOL, you can easily modify a .jar, or even release all the files in .class.
Called JAD Decompiler for java, get one.

Read full topic
